page.title: 03MORTEHOE CHURCH
page.content: The church of St Mary's in the centre of Mortehoe dates from 1109, though most of the church was built in the 13th century. It has Norman arches and a fine barrel roof. It was restored in 1857, and the lych gate was added in 1886. The original bells of 1432 were recast in 1926. At one time the vicarage was Easewell, now a farm. The list of Clergy of St Mary's dates back to 1258; the last incumbent died in May 1984. In 1985 Mortehoe church became part of the Ilfracombe Team Ministry. The Electoral roll is currently under revision and will be about 15-20 people. Services are held at 6.30 pm each Sunday evening, average attendance being 12. Current works in hand are a new heating boiler and repair work on the lych gate.
